comment: Dr. Conner made US history very easy and very straight forward. There was a very short quiz every week and she never went off schedule. There are a couple discussion posts, but nothing too bad. The textbook is very helpful and inquisitive definitely helps for studying. Overall Dr. Conner made the class very straight forward and easy to understand
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Online Savvy

comment: Dr. Conner's class was a pretty easy first education class. With some reading and small writing assignments, and a short paper or two. I enjoyed the class and gained some helpful knowledge.

Dr. Conner is awesome! I love history and she teaches it so well, and she doesn't include her personal opinions like a lot of professors. Dr. Conner simply teaches the truth, then she lets you form your own opinion. She requires a textbook, but don't pay for it. I got an A in the course and understood the material from the lectures alone.

A class that should have been an easy A, was very difficult because of the harsh grading, especially on the discussions. The discussions were mini papers & there were 4 of them. You must write it in Chicago style and respond to 2 peers. The midterm and the final were the complete opposite of what we were given to study.

We had weekly quizzes that were over the lectures+ textbook readings+ other readings she gave us for the week. The discussion posts were very harshly graded and the midterm+final were really hard and over the most specific details of the course, and the study guides were not helpful at all. Took too much of my time and energy for a gen ed course.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Professor Conner is a decent professor and I found her lectures interesting. The class mostly consisted of weekly quizzes. There are little assignments here and there but most of your grade comes from two exams, which are very detailed. However, she does give you everything you need to succeed, so just be sure to study.

I studied U.S. History 1 online with Dr. Conner. She is very professional and caring. All the teaching material available, including the lectures, is impeccable and directly related to the tests. The class is dynamic with a variety of quizzes and assignments, meaning you have a lot of opportunities to demonstrate your learning and earn good grades.

She's a great professor and her lectures are very interesting. The workload for this class was a bit heavy but doable. You are assigned a group at the beginning of the semester and you do many source analyses and 2 debates with them so hopefully, they pull their weight. Other than that, there are quizzes due almost every weekend.She's a good choice

Professor conner was a very good prof and she was easy to deal with. Super nice and respectful. The only downside of this class is if you don't like group work. She does keep attendance as a part of your grade but, tests and quizzes are easy and so are the assignments. A good choice for this class.
She keeps a tally of who participates and you do a decent amount of group work. There are two debates. But she is not a stingy grader. She does require attendants towards your grade

Dr. Conner is a great professor! She answers emails quickly and is always willing to help with assignments. However, she is an extremely tough grader and isnt the most understanding for any type of absence, even if theres documentation for it. She will push you to grow exponentially, but be ready to work hard for it!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Tough grader

comment: Really nice!
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: She is the best online professor you could ask for. She understands the limits of technology and how to use technology to benefit her students. She has a clear course outline and schedule. You always know what you are supposed to be doing. She should teach other teachers how to effectively teach online. A great teacher.

I had her class online in the fall and it was super easy! I'm not a history person, but she gave a clear rubric for graded assignments and responses fast to emails. Skimming through the textbook and listening to her lectures are enough for quizzes. Quiz are lockdown browser. Midterm and final was lockdown and camera. The material was easy to learn

I'm not great at History and I was able to pass this class with a B. She offers extra credit and drops the lowest quiz grade. She makes videos to go along with the readings. The discussion posts are a little difficult at first but easy once you understand it. Tests aren't super difficult if you're good at History or studied. I would recommend.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Her organization for online classes is incredible and it really helps you stay on top of your work.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. Conner is almost certainly the best choice to fulfill the U.S. history requirement at KSU, she offers the lightest workload with a ton of leniency when it comes to your use of the Chicago MOS for your citations. My only qualm with this course was the use of the webcam for midterms and finals,
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: For an online class, there is a lot of work! It is not hard but it is very time consuming. There are either quizzes or discussion each week along with lengthy assigned reading. The tests are lock down/web cam browser and the quizzes are lock down browser. If you study all the material she gives you, you can make an A but you definitely have to work
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: I took this class based on her in class reviews, and the online version was harder than expected. The discussions have strict format (Chicago style, in text citations, primary and secondary sources required) 1 paper that she grades hard, quizzes with lockdown browser, midterm and final with webcam. Doable, but not easy.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Tough grader

comment: I hate history but she made it enjoyable! Attendance is a grade and its a very interactive class. She puts a lot of effort in her lectures and makes the class fun. The work isnt hard at all and shes not a tough grader just do what she asks. For sure get in her class!!

It was an AMAZING course, and professor conner is incredible. I've never really enjoyed history, but I always looked forward to attending her class. I would recommend her to anyone. She's not super strict on grading, but she does expect you to know what you're talking about. Many group activities and in class assignments that can help your grade.
She's the best history teacher I've had. She gives very few homework assignments and her exams are super easy. Her lectures are not boring at all. Definitely recommend taking
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr. Conner was one of my favorite college professors I've had so far! She used to be a high school teacher so I think that's why she's so personable and doesn't grade too hard. You need to attend class because she does have an attendance policy but it's really not that bad because her lectures are exciting and make you want to listen. Love her!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Amazing lectures
